'''''Cortinarius collinitus''''' is a species of fungi in the [[family (biology)|family]] [[Cortinariaceae]].

==Description==
The [[Pileus (mycology)|cap]] is 3–9 cm in diameter, convex to flat in shape, with a sticky, gelatinous surface (in moist conditions). The gills are [[wikt:adnexed|adnexed]], close, and pallid or pale violet in color. The [[stipe (mycology)|stipe]] is typically 6–12 cm long and 1–1.5 cm thick, solid, equal, and has transverse scaly-looking bands. The [[spore print]], like most ''Cortiniarius'' species, is rusty-brown. Edibility is unknown for this species.<ref>Orr, R.T., Orr, D.B. (1979). ''Mushrooms of Western North America''. University of California Press: Berkeley. pg. 168.</ref>
